NVDA.overview: NVIDIA Corporation is the world leader in visual computing technologies and the pioneer of GPU-accelerated computing, currently dominating the AI hardware market.

AAPL.overview: Apple Inc. designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide, alongside a robust services segment.

MSFT.overview: Microsoft Corporation is a global technology giant providing software, services, devices, and solutions including Azure cloud services and Office productivity suites.

AMZN.overview: Amazon.com, Inc. focuses on e-commerce, cloud computing, online advertising, digital streaming, and artificial intelligence through its Amazon Web Services (AWS) division.

GOOGL.overview: Alphabet Inc. is a holding company, with Google as its largest subsidiary, specializing in internet-related services, search, and autonomous driving technology.

META.overview: Meta Platforms, Inc. builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses, primarily through Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp.

TSLA.overview: Tesla, Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, and sells electric vehicles, energy generation systems, and is a leader in autonomous driving software (FSD).

BRK.B.overview: Berkshire Hathaway Inc. is a conglomerate holding company overseen by Warren Buffett, owning businesses in insurance, rail transportation, energy, and retail.

AVGO.overview: Broadcom Inc. is a global technology leader that designs, develops, and supplies semiconductor and infrastructure software solutions.

LLY.overview: Eli Lilly and Company discovers, develops, and markets human pharmaceuticals worldwide, currently seeing massive growth in the weight-loss drug market.

JPM.overview: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is a leading global financial services firm and one of the largest banking institutions in the United States, with operations worldwide.

V.overview: Visa Inc. is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities across 200+ countries.

XOM.overview: Exxon Mobil Corporation is one of the world's largest publicly traded energy providers and chemical manufacturers, exploring for oil and natural gas on six continents.

UNH.overview: UnitedHealth Group Incorporated is a diversified healthcare company dedicated to helping people live healthier lives and making the health system work better for everyone.

MA.overview: Mastercard Incorporated is a global technology company in the payments industry that connects consumers, financial institutions, merchants, and businesses.

PG.overview: The Procter & Gamble Company focused on providing high-quality consumer packaged goods in the beauty, grooming, health care, fabric, and home care segments.

COST.overview: Costco Wholesale Corporation operates an international chain of membership warehouses that carry quality, brand-name merchandise at substantially lower prices.

HD.overview: The Home Depot, Inc. is the world's largest home improvement retailer, selling building materials, home improvement products, lawn and garden products, and decor.

JNJ.overview: Johnson & Johnson researches, develops, and manufactures a broad range of products in the healthcare field, primarily focused on pharmaceuticals and medical devices.

ORCL.overview: Oracle Corporation provides products and services that address enterprise information technology environments, including cloud infrastructure and database software.

AMD.overview: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. operates as a semiconductor company worldwide, producing CPUs and GPUs for the data center, gaming, and PC markets.

NFLX.overview: Netflix, Inc. provides entertainment services including TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages directly to subscribers.

BAC.overview: Bank of America Corporation is a multinational investment bank and financial services holding company, serving approximately 66 million consumer and small business clients.

KO.overview: The Coca-Cola Company is a total beverage company, selling its products in more than 200 countries and territories with a massive portfolio of billion-dollar brands.

PEP.overview: PepsiCo, Inc. is a global food and beverage leader with a product portfolio that includes 22 brands that generate more than $1 billion each in annual retail sales.

CVX.overview: Chevron Corporation manages its investments in subsidiaries and affiliates and is engaged in integrated energy and chemicals operations worldwide.

ADBE.overview: Adobe Inc. is a diversified software company worldwide, operating through three segments: Digital Media, Digital Experience, and Publishing and Advertising.

CRM.overview: Salesforce, Inc. provides customer relationship management technology that brings companies and customers together globally through its Customer 360 platform.

WMT.overview: Walmart Inc. operates retail, wholesale, and other units worldwide, offering an assortment of merchandise and services at everyday low prices.

DIS.overview: The Walt Disney Company is a worldwide entertainment company with segments including Entertainment, Sports, and Experiences.

ACN.overview: Accenture plc is a professional services company that provides strategy, consulting, interactive, technology, and operations services worldwide.

CSCO.overview: Cisco Systems, Inc. designs, manufactures, and sells Internet Protocol-based networking and other products related to the communications and IT industry.

VZ.overview: Verizon Communications Inc. provides communications, technology, information, and entertainment products and services to consumers, businesses, and government entities.

INTC.overview: Intel Corporation designs, manufactures, and sells computer components and related products for business and consumer markets worldwide, including its foundry services.

ABT.overview: Abbott Laboratories is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life, with a portfolio spanning diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and medicines.

DHR.overview: Danaher Corporation is a global science and technology innovator committed to helping customers solve complex challenges and improving quality of life around the world.

CAT.overview: Caterpillar Inc. is the world's leading manufacturer of construction and mining equipment, diesel and natural gas engines, industrial gas turbines, and diesel-electric locomotives.

GE.overview: GE Aerospace is a world-leading provider of jet and turboprop engines, components, and integrated systems for commercial, military, business, and general aviation aircraft.

IBM.overview: International Business Machines (IBM) is a global technology and consulting company specializing in hybrid cloud, artificial intelligence, and quantum computing solutions.

PLTR.overview: Palantir Technologies builds platforms for integrating, managing, and securing data, with its Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP) driving massive commercial growth.

AXP.overview: American Express is a globally integrated payments company, providing customers with access to products, insights, and experiences that enrich lives and build business success.

UBER.overview: Uber Technologies Inc. is a technology platform that uses its network to connect consumers with rides, food delivery, and logistics services globally.

SBUX.overview: Starbucks Corporation is the premier roaster, marketer, and retailer of specialty coffee in the world, operating more than 40,000 stores globally.

LOW.overview: Lowe's Companies, Inc. is a FORTUNE 50 home improvement company serving approximately 16 million customer transactions a week in the United States.

SPGI.overview: S&P Global provides essential intelligence, including ratings, benchmarks, analytics, and data to the capital and commodity markets worldwide.

INTU.overview: Intuit is a global financial technology platform that helps consumers and small businesses prosper through products like TurboTax, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp.

QCOM.overview: Qualcomm is the world's leading wireless technology innovator and the driving force behind the development and launch of 5G and mobile computing.

AMAT.overview: Applied Materials is the leader in materials engineering solutions used to produce virtually every new chip and advanced display in the world.

MU.overview: Micron Technology is a world leader in innovative memory and storage solutions, currently surging due to massive demand for AI-grade HBM chips.

T.overview: AT&T is a leading provider of communications and digital entertainment services, focusing on 5G wireless and fiber broadband infrastructure.

PFE.overview: Pfizer Inc. is a leading global biopharmaceutical company that develops and produces medicines and vaccines for a wide range of conditions, including oncology, cardiology, and immunology.

PM.overview: Philip Morris International is a leading international tobacco company working to deliver a smoke-free future and evolving its portfolio for the long-term to include products outside of the tobacco and nicotine sector.

NKE.overview: NIKE, Inc. is the world's leading designer, marketer, and distributor of authentic athletic footwear, apparel, equipment, and accessories for a wide variety of sports and fitness activities.

UNP.overview: Union Pacific Corporation is a leading logistics company that connects 23 states in the western two-thirds of the United States by rail, providing a critical link in the global supply chain.

HON.overview: Honeywell International Inc. is a diversified technology and manufacturing leader, serving customers worldwide with aerospace products and services, control technologies, and performance materials.

RTX.overview: RTX Corporation is an aerospace and defense company that provides advanced systems and services for commercial, military, and government customers worldwide through its Collins, Pratt & Whitney, and Raytheon businesses.

GS.overview: The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc. is a leading global investment banking, securities, and investment management firm that provides a wide range of financial services to a substantial and diversified client base.

MS.overview: Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm that provides a wide range of investment banking, securities, wealth management, and investment management services.

TMO.overview: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc. is the world leader in serving science, providing an unmatched combination of innovative technologies, purchasing convenience, and pharmaceutical services.

ISRG.overview: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. designs, manufactures, and markets the da Vinci Surgical System and related instruments and accessories, pioneering the field of robotic-assisted surgery.

NOW.overview: ServiceNow, Inc. provides a cloud-based platform and solutions that digitize and unify workflows so that enterprise operations can run more efficiently and productively.

BKNG.overview: Booking Holdings Inc. is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to consumers and local partners through its primary brands including Booking.com and Kayak.

MDLZ.overview: Mondelez International, Inc. empowers people to snack right in over 150 countries with global brands such as Oreo, belVita, and LU biscuits, as well as Cadbury Dairy Milk.

ABNB.overview: Airbnb, Inc. operates a global marketplace where hosts offer guests unique stays and experiences through its mobile app and website.

LRCX.overview: Lam Research Corporation is a global supplier of innovative wafer fabrication equipment and services to the semiconductor industry.

SYK.overview: Stryker Corporation is one of the world's leading medical technology companies, offering innovative products and services in Medical and Surgical, Neurotechnology, Orthopaedics, and Spine.

TJX.overview: The TJX Companies, Inc. is the leading off-price retailer of apparel and home fashions in the U.S. and worldwide, operating brands like T.J. Maxx and Marshalls.

SCHW.overview: The Charles Schwab Corporation provides a full range of wealth management, securities brokerage, banking, asset management, custody, and financial advisory services.

VRTX.overview: Vertex Pharmaceuticals Incorporated is a global biotechnology company that invests in scientific innovation to create transformative medicines for people with serious diseases.

EL.overview: The Est√©e Lauder Companies Inc. is one of the world's leading manufacturers and marketers of quality skin care, makeup, fragrance, and hair care products.

C.overview: Citigroup Inc. is a leading global bank that has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions.

BLK.overview: BlackRock, Inc. is the world's largest asset manager, providing a broad range of investment and technology services to institutional and retail clients worldwide.

ADP.overview: Automatic Data Processing, Inc. is a leading global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, and tax compliance.

BA.overview: The Boeing Company is a major aerospace firm and a leading manufacturer of commercial jetliners and defense, space, and security systems.

LMT.overview: Lockheed Martin Corporation is a global security and aerospace company engaged in the research, design, and manufacturing of advanced technology systems, including the F-35 fighter jet.

UPS.overview: United Parcel Service, Inc. is one of the world's largest package delivery companies and a leading provider of global supply chain management solutions.

MDT.overview: Medtronic plc is a global leader in medical technology, services, and solutions, helping to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life for millions of people.

AMGN.overview: Amgen Inc. is a biotechnology pioneer that discovers, develops, and delivers innovative human therapeutics to treat serious illnesses.

ADI.overview: Analog Devices, Inc. is a world leader in the design and manufacture of high-performance integrated circuits (ICs) used in virtually all types of electronic equipment.

DE.overview: Deere & Company is a world leader in providing advanced products and services for those whose work is linked to the land, including agriculture and construction.

CVS.overview: CVS Health Corporation is a diversified health services company that provides health insurance, pharmacy benefits management, and retail pharmacy services.

ZTS.overview: Zoetis Inc. is the world's leading animal health company, focused on the discovery, development, and manufacture of medicines, vaccines, and diagnostic products.

MMC.overview: Marsh & McLennan Companies, Inc. is a global professional services firm offering clients advice and solutions in risk, strategy, and people.

FI.overview: Fiserv, Inc. is a global leader in payments and financial technology, helping clients achieve best-in-class results through a commitment to innovation.

GILD.overview: Gilead Sciences, Inc. is a research-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, develops, and commercializes innovative medicines in areas of unmet medical need.

BMY.overview: Bristol Myers Squibb is a global biopharmaceutical company whose mission is to discover, develop, and deliver innovative medicines that help patients prevail over serious diseases.

BSX.overview: Boston Scientific Corporation is a worldwide developer, manufacturer, and marketer of medical devices that are used in a broad range of interventional medical specialties.

CB.overview: Chubb Limited is the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, with operations in 54 countries and territories.

REGN.overview: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, Inc. is a leading biotechnology company that invents life-transforming medicines for people with serious diseases.

EOG.overview: EOG Resources, Inc. is one of the largest independent crude oil and natural gas companies in the United States.

KLAC.overview: KLA Corporation is a leading supplier of process control and yield management solutions for the semiconductor and related nanoelectronics industries.

HCA.overview: HCA Healthcare, Inc. is one of the nation's leading providers of healthcare services, operating over 180 hospitals and approximately 2,300 sites of care.

CDNS.overview: Cadence Design Systems, Inc. is a leading provider of electronic design automation (EDA) software, hardware, and IP that help customers create complex electronic systems.

SNPS.overview: Synopsys, Inc. is a global leader in electronic design automation (EDA) and semiconductor IP, providing tools and services for chip design and software security.

PANW.overview: Palo Alto Networks, Inc. is the global cybersecurity leader, providing network security, cloud security, and endpoint protection via its integrated platform.

SHW.overview: The Sherwin-Williams Company is a global leader in the manufacture, development, and sale of paints, coatings, and related products to professional and retail customers.

WM.overview: Waste Management, Inc. is North America's leading provider of comprehensive waste management environmental services, specializing in collection, recycling, and disposal.

MO.overview: Altria Group, Inc. is one of the world's largest producers and marketers of tobacco, cigarettes, and related products.

MELI.overview: MercadoLibre, Inc. is the leading e-commerce and fintech platform in Latin America, often referred to as the 'Amazon of Latin America.'
